result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael G Rinderle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Threat to Injure/Accuse Crime-Official, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.30(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael G Rinderle in court, in custody, with attorney Michael F. Hart.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to the charge. Court found defendant guilty.

Defendant sentenced to the following:
JAIL:     60 DAYS    CREDIT:  47 days

DNA SAMPLE TO BE PROVIDED; $250.00 DNA SURCHARGE ORDERED TO BE PAID WITHIN 60 DAYS. IF NOT PAID; TO BE CONVERTED TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT.

FINE or COSTS: WAIVED BY COURT

FELONY WARNINGS:  Voting Rights And Firearms Warnings Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 6, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Michael G Rinderle in court, in custody, with attorney Dan Sanders for  Michael F Hart.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties request adjournment.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Hart requests the court waive the preliminary.
